bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Order in re Bail
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Petition of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, and Sister M. Angelique, Sister Superior of the House of the Good Shephard, for a Writ of Certiorari. }
James P. Lavin, Immigrant inspector, and Sister M. Angelique, Appellants. Vs. Yvonne LeFevre, Georgette Normand and Marie LeFevre, Respondents}

An appeal having been taken in the above entitled cause, and the respondednts being in custody and desiring to be admitted to bail, and the court having fixed the amount of their bail at five hundred dollars ($500.) for each of the respondents, said sum of $1500 is this day deposited by said respondents to the credit of the Unites States, the condition of its deposit being that if the respondents and each of them shall abide and answer the final determination of this cause,either in this court or upon appeal, and surrender themselves, on the order of the court, either into the custody of the Marshal of this court of the Immigrant Officers, and submit to the final determination and judgment herein, then this obligation to be void and such money to be returned to the respondent; otherwise to be and became the property of the United States and be convered into the United States Treasury.
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
In re- James P. Lavin et al. vs. Petitioners
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court DIST OF WASHINGTON Mar 6 1903 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk
Filed , 190 , Clerk By HM Walthew Deputy
